formattedCourseData.title: Fundamentals of Sound Recording
formattedCourseData.description: This course targets individuals interested in entering the field of sound engineering and aims to enhance their understanding of how sound enriches the viewer's experience. It will focus on the significance of ambient sounds and how to record them clearly and cleanly. Through the exploration of sound engineering techniques and equipment, you will learn how to effectively integrate sounds into scenes, thereby enhancing storytelling and adding depth to cinematic works.
formattedCourseData.whatyoulearn: In this course, you will explore the essential role of the sound engineer and the significant impact sound has on enhancing the cinematic experience. You will gain a thorough understanding of the tools and equipment used by sound engineers and learn how to analyze scripts to prevent mistakes during filming. The course will also cover the challenges sound engineers often face and provide effective strategies to overcome them. Key topics include the responsibilities of the sound team, different types of microphones and their uses, how recording devices operate, and techniques for managing echo in recording environments.

instructors.name: Aseel Radwan
description: Aseel is a sound engineer who began his career in 2016, working on several popular TV series, including "Takki," "Al3aila," and "Sikkat Safar 2." He has also worked on various television programs, overseeing sound engineering for shows like "Seen" with Ahmad Al-Shuqairi, "Warshat En3ash," and "Braves". Additionally, Aseel has contributed to short films such as "Khawkh," "The Game of Life," and "12:00."
